required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 3 Safety and Immunogenicity Study of aQIV in Elderly Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind, Controlled, Multicenter, Clinical Study to Evaluate Safety and Immunogenicity of an MF59-Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine in Comparison With an MF59-Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine and an MF59-Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Containing the Alternate B Strain, in Adults Aged 65 Years and Above

brief_summary.textblock: This phase 3 study is a randomized, double-blinded, comparator controlled, parallel-group, multicenter study of aQIV versus the US-licensed 2017-2018 adjuvanted trivalent influenza vaccine (aTIV-1, Fluad), and versus an adjuvanted trivalent influenza vaccine (aTIV-2), containing the alternate B strain.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The trial is designed as a double-blind study

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity Endpoint: The Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) ratio for the four strains included in the vaccines.
primary_outcome.description: The GMT ratio is defined as the geometric mean of the post-vaccination HI titer for aTIV-1 (or aTIV-2) over the geometric mean of postvaccination HI titer for aQIV.

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity Endpoint: The difference between the seroconversion rate (SCR) for the four strains included in the vaccines.
primary_outcome.description: The SCR is defined as the percentage of subjects with either a prevaccination HI titer < 1:10 and a post-vaccination HI titer ≥ 1: 40 or a prevaccination HI titer ≥ 1:10 and a ≥ 4-fold increase in postvaccination HI titer.

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity Endpoint: The percent of subjects achieving seroconversion for HI antibody for the four strains included in the vaccines.
Immunogenicity Endpoint: The percent of subjects achieving an HI antibody titer ≥ 1:40 for the four strains included in the vaccines.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity Endpoint: Geometric mean of HI titers against homologous strains
Immunogenicity Endpoint: Geometric mean ratio (GMR) of post vaccination HI titer over the pre-vaccination HI titer against homologous strains
Immunogenicity Endpoint: The percentage of subjects with a titer ≥1:40 against homologous strains

Immunogenicity Endpoint: The percentage of subjects with either a prevaccination HI titer < 1:10 and a postvaccination HI titer ≥ 1:40 or a prevaccination titer ≥ 1:10 and a ≥ 4- fold increase in postvaccination titer against homologous strains
Immunogenicity Endpoint: GMT ratio for each B virus strain
secondary_outcome.description: The immunologic superiority of HI antibody responses for the alternate B strain in aQIV will be assessed for each aTIV separately

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity Endpoint: Difference in SCR for each B virus strain
secondary_outcome.description: The immunologic superiority of HI antibody responses for the alternate B strain in aQIV will be assessed for each aTIV separately

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Endpoint: Number of subjects with solicited local and systemic adverse events (AEs) following vaccination
Safety Endpoint: Number of subjects with Unsolicited AEs
Safety Endpoint: Number of subjects with Serious AEs (SAEs), AEs leading to withdrawal from the study, new onset of chronic diseases (NOCDs) and AEs of special interest (AESIs)

arm_group.description: MF59-adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine (aQIV) contains each of the 2 influenza type A strains and each of the two influenza type B strains in the vaccine.
Licensed MF59-adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine (aTIV-1) contains each of the 2 influenza type A strains and one influenza type B strain in the vaccine.
MF59-adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine contains each of the 2 influenza type A strains and alternate influenza type B strain in the vaccine.

intervention.intervention_name: MF59-adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine (aQIV)
intervention.description: The strain composition is that recommended by the World Health Organization for the 2017-2018 Northern Hemisphere influenza season (WHO, 2017) for quadrivalent vaccines.

intervention.intervention_name: Licensed MF59-adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine (aTIV-1)
intervention.description: The strain composition is that recommended by the World Health Organization for the 2017-2018 Northern Hemisphere influenza season (WHO, 2017) for trivalent vaccines.

intervention.intervention_name: MF59-adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Inactivated Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine Containing the Alternate B Strain (aTIV-2)
intervention.description: The strain composition is that recommended by the World Health Organization for the 2017-2018 Northern Hemisphere influenza season (WHO, 2017) for trivalent vaccines except the B strain present in this vaccine is the second/alternate B strain recommended for inclusion in quadrivalent vaccines (ie, Alternate B strain).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females ≥ 65 years old who are healthy or have co-morbidities
- Individuals who or whose legal representative(s) have voluntarily given written consent after the nature of the study has been explained according to local regulatory requirements, prior to study entry
- Ability to attend all scheduled visits and to comply with study procedures including Diary card completion and follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of behavioral or cognitive impairment or psychiatric condition
- Hypersensitivity, including allergy, to any component of vaccines, medicinal products or medical equipment whose use is foreseen in this study
- Abnormal function of the immune system
- Receipt of any influenza vaccine within 6 months prior to enrollment in this study, or plan to receive influenza vaccine prior to the Day 22 blood collection
- Any other clinical condition that, in the opinion of the Investigator, might interfere with the results of the study or pose additional risk to the subject due to participation in the study
Additional eligibility criteria may be discussed by contacting the site.
